title: Data Theft L3 – DNS exfil – SWG Audit
description: Data theft simulation: DNS exfil. Small payload sent to server. Request succeeds = perimeter did not block. Request blocked = review SWG or DNS logs.
keywords: SWG Audit, data theft test, DNS exfil, exfiltration, perimeter security
headline: Data Theft – Level 3: DNS exfil simulation
testObjective: Test whether your SWG can detect and block DNS tunneling and encoded data exfiltration attempts hidden in URL query parameters.
attackVector: Attackers encode sensitive data in DNS queries or HTTP request parameters to bypass traditional DLP inspection, as these channels often receive less scrutiny than file uploads.

steps.title: Configure your SWG
steps.description: Whitelist swgaudit.com to allow access to this page. Your SWG should monitor query parameters for suspicious patterns.

steps.title: Verify your identity
steps.description: Submit your business email to unlock the simulation.

steps.title: Run the test
steps.description: Trigger the simulated exfiltration request. If your SWG blocks it, check logs for the detection. If the request succeeds and reaches our server, your perimeter failed to detect DNS-style exfiltration.

feedbackFail: Exfil request reached server = perimeter did not block DNS‑style exfiltration.
feedbackPass: Request blocked or failed = perimeter passed.
